item.title: Road is uneven, 14th September
item.description:
The recent work on this part of the road has made it worse. It was such an awful short term fix and waste of money. This stretch of the road will damage cars. This needs to be corrected immediately, otherwise I will be contacting the local MP to highlight the issue and the waste in taxpayer money.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foul water going down Mill street as far as Church Court Cottages from Southam Road, 14th September
item.description:
Dirty smelling water affecting walkers that use the street, had to warn a young couple with toddlers on bicycles. Cars sending up spray at any pedestrians in vicinity.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Road, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor repair of granite sets, 14th September
item.description:
The tarmac repair of the granite setts is poor. The edge to the collapsed part of the road still exists and results in severe and sharp bump when passing over with a vehicle. The step feels so severe (as the wheels are turning whilst riding over the area) that it rocks the car and must be a flat tyre and/or suspension damage risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge potholes all along this road, 14th September
item.description:
From the signpost at the junction of Whittington pointing to Cleeve Common right up to the Cleeve Common road there are multiple huge potholes along this road, There is also a large amount of loose gravel on the road which I think has washed out of previous repairs and continues washing down the road when there is heavy rain. The number of cars using this road had multiplied because the A40 is closed and so the problem is only going to get worse especially as winter approaches. A whole resurface would be best option in my opinion but repair as soon as possible would be great. The potholes are very deep and very wide,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous graffiti, 14th September
item.description:
Why is there a red cross on the roundabout? Is it out of use? Or is it the right wing weaponising nationalistic symbolism to bully immigrants and make people feel unwelcome in our village? Either way it's not acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous traffic on Church Street, Charlton Kings, 13th September
item.description:
Church Street, near the Yangtze & Merryfellow pub. The traffic around Charlton kings is absolute carnage due to London Road closure. There is a bottle neck in the area identified and lorries are ignoring the signs saying ‘not suitable’ & using Ch King, Church St and East end Road as a cut through. There are traffic jams, cars and lorries mounting pavements and drivers being aggressive as they are having to wait. There are 3 schools and 2 nurseries in this area and I have seen cars up on the pavement while families are walking on them at school pick up. Cars are speeding too if no jams (!) - this is highly dangerous and the diversion arrangements need to be addressed straight away as it will not be long before an accident will happen here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Lakes forming in cycleway, 13th September
item.description:
In the new cycleway on the north and south sides of the Walnut Close access there are dips where the rainwater forms large puddles which do not drain away. This may be due to drainage blockages but appears to be construction faults leaving the dips.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Walnut Close, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
